question: Chris has a vegetable stand at the street bazaar. He sells three kinds of vegetables: daisies, lilies and sunflowers. He usually sells daisies for $1.5842857142857143 per bouquet, lilies for $2.7715384615384617 per bouquet and sunflowers for $5.8580000000000005 per bouquet. Chris has no change today, so he has decided to round all his prices to the nearest dollar. If Chris sells 12 bouquets of daisies, 21 bouquets of lilies and 36 bouquets of sunflowers, how much will he make?
answer:
Chris will round his daisies up from $1.5842857142857143 to $2, since the number following the 1 is 5 or higher.
Chris will round his lilies up from $2.7715384615384617 to $3, since the number following the 2 is 5 or higher.
Chris will round his sunflowers up from $5.8580000000000005 to $6, since the number following the 5 is 5 or higher.
Chris sells 12 daisies*$2 = $<<12*2=24>>24
Chris sells 21 lilies*$3 = $<<21*3=63>>63
Chris sells 36 sunflowers*$6 = $<<36*6=216>>216
Altogether, Chris will make $24 + $63 + $216 = $<<24+63+216=303>>303
#### 303
